# Heat and Work {#heat_work}

## Heat Required to Heat Steel

A steel block of mass $m = 5\ \text{kg}$ and specific heat capacity $c = 480\ \text{J/kg·K}$ is heated from $T_1 = 15^\circ \text{C}$ to $T_2 = 100^\circ \text{C}$. Determine the **heat required**.

### The formula for heat

$$
Q = m c \Delta T
$$ {#eq-heat}

where

\
$\Delta T = T_2 - T_1$ is the temperature change.

### Compute the temperature change

$$
\Delta T = T_2 - T_1 = 100 - 15 = 85\ \text{K}
$$

### Compute the heat required

$$
Q = m c \Delta T = 5 \times 480 \times 85
$$

$$
Q = 204,000\ \text{J}
$$

### Answer

The **heat required** to raise the temperature of the steel is:

$$
\boxed{204\ \text{kJ}}
$$

### Code

``` python
# Heat Required to Heat Steel

# Given data
mass = 5            # kg
specific_heat = 480 # J/kg·K
T_initial = 15      # °C
T_final = 100       # °C

# Temperature change
delta_T = T_final - T_initial

# Heat required (in J)
Q_J = mass * specific_heat * delta_T

# Convert to kJ
Q_kJ = Q_J / 1000

# Print results
print(f"Temperature change: {delta_T} K")
print(f"Heat required: {Q_J:.0f} J ({Q_kJ:.0f} kJ)")
```


## Finding Specific Heat Capacity

A liquid of mass $m = 4\ \text{kg}$ is heated from $T_1 = 15^\circ \text{C}$ to $T_2 = 100^\circ \text{C}$. The heat supplied is $Q = 714\ \text{kJ}$. Determine the **specific heat capacity** $c$ of the liquid.

### Recall the formula for heat

$$
Q = m c \Delta T
$$

where $\Delta T = T_2 - T_1$.

### Convert heat to joules

$$
Q = 714\ \text{kJ} = 714 \times 1000 = 714,000\ \text{J}
$$

### Compute temperature change

$$
\Delta T = T_2 - T_1 = 100 - 15 = 85\ \text{K}
$$

### Solve for specific heat capacity

$$
c = \frac{Q}{m \Delta T} = \frac{714,000}{4 \times 85}
$$

$$
c = \frac{714,000}{340} \approx 2100\ \text{J/kg·K}
$$

### Answer

The **specific heat capacity** of the liquid is:

$$
\boxed{c \approx 2100\ \text{J/kg·K}}
$$

### Code

``` python
# Specific Heat Capacity Calculation

# Given data
mass = 4          # kg
T_initial = 15    # °C
T_final = 100     # °C
Q_kJ = 714        # heat supplied in kJ

# Convert heat to joules
Q_J = Q_kJ * 1000

# Temperature change
delta_T = T_final - T_initial

# Calculate specific heat capacity
c = Q_J / (mass * delta_T)

# Print results
print(f"Temperature change: {delta_T} K")
print(f"Specific heat capacity: {c:.0f} J/kg·K")
```

``` python
# Calculate specific heat capacity

# Display results
print("\nCalculation Results:")
print(f"Temperature change: {delta_T:.2f} K")
print(f"Specific heat capacity: {c:.2f} J/kg·K")
```

## Work Done by Fluid in Cylinder

A fluid in a cylinder is at pressure $P = 700\ \text{kPa}$. It is **expanded at constant pressure** from a volume of $V_1 = 0.28\ \text{m³}$ to $V_2 = 1.68\ \text{m³}$. Determine the **work done**.

### The formula for work done at constant pressure

$$
W = P \Delta V
$$ {#eq-workcp}

where

$$
\Delta V = V_2 - V_1
$$

### Compute the change in volume

$$
\Delta V = 1.68 - 0.28 = 1.40\ \text{m³}
$$

### Convert pressure to Pa

$$
P = 700\ \text{kPa} = 700 \times 10^3\ \text{Pa} = 700,000\ \text{Pa}
$$

### Compute the work done

$$
W = P \Delta V = 700,000 \times 1.40
$$

$$
W = 980,000\ \text{J} \approx 980\ \text{kJ}
$$

### Answer

The **work done** by the fluid during expansion is:

$$
\boxed{980\ \text{kJ}}
$$

### Code

``` python
# Work Done by Fluid at Constant Pressure

# Given data
P_kPa = 700          # pressure in kPa
V1 = 0.28            # initial volume in m³
V2 = 1.68            # final volume in m³

# Convert pressure to Pa
P_Pa = P_kPa * 1000

# Compute change in volume
delta_V = V2 - V1

# Compute work done (J)
W_J = P_Pa * delta_V

# Convert to kJ
W_kJ = W_J / 1000

# Print results
print(f"Pressure: {P_Pa} Pa")
print(f"Change in volume: {delta_V:.2f} m³")
print(f"Work done: {W_J:.0f} J ({W_kJ:.0f} kJ)")
```
